page.title: 09A Local Vicar's typical day
page.content: We visited the Rev. Neville Kent, vicar of Bradford, Hillfarrance, Oake, and Heathfield parishes. He showed us round Bradford and Hillfarrance Churches and talked about a typical day in his life. In the morning he gets up and has his breakfast. After he goes to church and says his prayers, he sees that everything is in an orderly fashion. He then sits down and writes letters to people, prepares services or takes assembly at Oake School. In the afternoon he goes to visit people in hospital or in an old peoples' home. In the evening he has to go to meetings which go on for a long time. So, if you think a vicar just sits in a chair and rests all day and takes a service on a Sunday you are wrong. He is a very busy person.
